Key Match Events: Max Schuemann hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning
Lawrence Butler hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning
Zack Gelof added a solo shot in the eighth
Mason Miller struck out pinch-hitter Amed Rosario for his 22nd save
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds, who have five starting pitchers on the injured list, figured to go deep into their bullpen on Tuesday
Nick Lodolo (left middle finger strain) was placed on the 15-day injured list, retroactive to Aug. 24
Brandon Williamson (shoulder strain) was sent to Triple-A Louisville on a rehab assignment
Stuart Fairchild (left thumb sprain) was placed on the 10-day IL
Post-Match Reflections: When we've been behind where we haven't scored first, we haven't been very successful this season
It's nice that we got a come-from-behind win tonight and finished it off
Miscellaneous Highlights: Oakland had one hit and trailed 1-0 through six innings
Mitch Spence allowed a run and five hits in 5 1/3 innings
Jakob Junis made his fourth start of the season, first since joining the Reds
The Reds' bullpen had to work hard to secure the win
Oakland has 162 home runs, which was tied with the Minnesota Twins for seventh in the majors
More than 50% of the runs for the A's this season have come on homers
